Posts.Content: I use Sanex Dermo Sensitive spray which has been OK for me. It's widely available.
Posts.Title: Deodorant

Posts.Content: I have wonderful friends and family but the one friend I talk to most had a mastectomy many years ago. The others are wonderfully supportive but don't know exactly how I am feeling like she does. I think that the people on this forum know how I am feeling and it's good to know that there are places where you can share your thoughts with like minded people.
Posts.Title: You are not alone

Posts.Content: I agree with other replies in that each session only takes a few minutes. It's the getting into a yoga type position that takes longer than the actual treatment! Moisturising is important, I used Epaderm because that suits me as I have eczema and I can't use certain other moisturisers. Just find one that suits your skin and apply it as often as possible. The staff were told to keep an eye on my skin because of the eczema but apart from a bit of redness I had no problems.
Posts.Title: 1st Radiotherapy session tomorrow...really scared

Posts.Content: I know exactly how you feel as I have an "odd" pair now as well. I saw an advert for John Lewis saying that they had specialist people who did bra measurements for people who had a mastectomy. The nearest John Lewis takes half an hour to drive to so I rang to make sure that they had someone who could cope with my odd ones. I went along and the woman who measured me was extremely helpful, kind and caring. She presented me with a few bras which were pretty and fit well. OK, the one I chose was more expensive than M&S but I felt that it was worth it.
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: I think that we sometimes need some levity. Every time I see FEC now, this image will come to mind!
Posts.Title: Start of journey part 2

Posts.Content: I have just read something on another site about a song which was somebody's anthem after BC. Mine is Bon Jovi's "Someday I'll Be Saturday Night" which starts "Hey, man, I'm alive, I'm takin' each day and night at a time, I'm feelin' like a Monday, but someday I'll be Saturday night". I just wondered if anyone else has their own anthem?
Posts.Title: Anthem

Posts.Content: Please tell your oncologist about the tamoxifen. I had severe problems with it and rang the hospital. They rang back 2 hours later telling me to stop taking it immediately. There are several drugs available so you don't have to carry on with one which doesn't suit you.
Posts.Title: problem with everything

Posts.Content: Reading this helped me: https://community.macmillan.org.uk/blogs/b/new_information_available/archive/2015/09/15/after-cancer-treatment-has-ended The comparison to the boat lost at sea described exactly how I feel.
Posts.Title: Down

Posts.Content: I agree that you should wait and see what Letrozole does to you. I didn't have the joint pain but I did have a terrible skin rash. We are all different and there's not much you or the doctors can do until you know what, if any, side effects you get. A friend has been on Letrozole for almost 5 years with hardly any side effects so with a bit of luck you will be like her.
Posts.Title: Zoladex and Letrozole - acupuncture therapy?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for posting this. I Googled, found it and have just read it with tears in my eyes because he could have been writing about me! It is nice to know that other people have experienced the same feelings and that you are not alone.
Posts.Title: Getting back to "normal"

Posts.Content: I used Get Going http://www.getgoinginsurance.co.uk/ which I found good value.
Posts.Title: Travel insurance recommendations for Europe

Posts.Content: Thanks for the post. I didn't know about this and have just joined.
Posts.Title: Opportunity if you didn't like Brave the Shave campaign

Posts.Content: A friend lost all her hair due to chemo a few years ago. When it eventually came back it was quite different but thick and curly. Now, she always looks as though she has just stepped out of the hairdressers and if she is caught in the rain her hair just springs back into shape. I hope yours is the same!
Posts.Title: Something good for a change

Posts.Content: I have just read the article "10 Cancer Myths De-bunked" and think that it should be compulsory reading for everyone immediately after diagnosis!
Posts.Title: Dangerous internet information

Posts.Content: I have just seen a web site which says "Some say the lemon is a proven remedy against all types of cancer" and "Lemon is effective in killing cancer cells because it is allegedly 10,000 stronger than chemotherapy". What worries me is that some people will believe this and possibly refuse chemotherapy because they have read it.
Posts.Title: Dangerous internet information

Posts.Content: I found that a glass of wine helped me get to sleep rather than lying in bed thinking about things. I'm 6 months post op and still using that excuse!
Posts.Title: Red wine

Posts.Content: I have just seen this on Facebook and remembered this post!
Posts.Title: Looking for a good light (thin) Moisturiser ?
